page.title: 08Vegetables at Pullen's Farm
page.content: On Pullen's Farm they had rows of polythene tunnels, in which {strawberries}and{lettuces}are grown. There were two different types of lettuces, which were Sitonian and Crisp. These were sold to wholesalers, supermarkets and hypermarkets. The Crisp lettuces are grown outside, the Sitonians inside the tunnels. Conifer trees are used as protection around the tunnels. Other vegetables, such as {cauliflowers}and{potatoes}are grown. Cauliflowers are surrounded by an electric fence which stops{rabbits} from eating the plants. Twenty women pick, wash and package the vegetables. After harvest, the ground is destoned and rotavated.
